Instruction:
Task Description: Implement a Netty-based TCP server for handling remote commands with connection management and idle state detection.

Class Description: NettyRemotingServer is a TCP server implementation using Netty framework that handles incoming remote commands, manages client connections, and provides event notification for connection changes. It supports configurable thread pools, connection idle detection, and custom channel event handling.

Attributes:
- serverBootstrap: ServerBootstrap - Netty server bootstrap instance for server configuration
- bossSelectorGroup: EventLoopGroup - Netty event loop group for accepting connections
- workerSelectorGroup: EventLoopGroup - Netty event loop group for handling I/O operations
- defaultEventExecutorGroup: DefaultEventExecutorGroup - Thread pool for business logic processing
- appContext: AppContext - Application context for dependency injection
- LOGGER: Logger - Logger instance for server operations logging

Methods:
- NettyRemotingServer(AppContext, RemotingServerConfig) -> void - Constructor with application context and server configuration
- NettyRemotingServer(RemotingServerConfig, ChannelEventListener) -> void - Constructor with server configuration and channel event listener
- serverStart() -> void - Starts the Netty server, initializes thread pools and configures server bootstrap
- serverShutdown() -> void - Shuts down the server gracefully, releasing all resources
- NettyServerHandler: channelRead0(ChannelHandlerContext, RemotingCommand) -> void - Handles incoming message processing
- NettyConnectManageHandler: channelRegistered(ChannelHandlerContext) -> void - Logs channel registration events
- NettyConnectManageHandler: channelUnregistered(ChannelHandlerContext) -> void - Logs channel unregistration events
- NettyConnectManageHandler: channelActive(ChannelHandlerContext) -> void - Handles new active connections
- NettyConnectManageHandler: channelInactive(ChannelHandlerContext) -> void - Handles connection close events
- NettyConnectManageHandler: userEventTriggered(ChannelHandlerContext, Object) -> void - Handles idle state events
- NettyConnectManageHandler: exceptionCaught(ChannelHandlerContext, Throwable) -> void - Handles channel exceptions
